titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: The glass falling, & a rain–announcing wind gave an evil impression as I went to the early Communion. There were 34 cts, & would have been 35 had not one fainted, & been carried out.
About 10 a.m. it started to rain, & my last hopes of a good Offertory vanished.
There was a wretched congregation: I preached with a sinking heart: the offertory fell short of £35. The least amount which will be necessary is £150!
The evening congregation was not large, but it was relatively generous. £23 was added to the fund.
During the week I appealed by letter to the seatholders, & received about £50.
By the end of the week, the Fund amounted to £111.14.6
